message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of several hundred pigmented lesions suggests the patient has multiple nevi or moles, which are a risk factor for melanoma, a malignant tumor. S100 protein is expressed in melanocytes, and its presence in epithelioid cells with fine granules is a key diagnostic feature of melanoma. Atypical keratinocytes forming keratin pearls are characteristic of squamous cell carcinoma. Mucin-filled cells with peripheral nuclei and pale, round cells with palisading nuclei are associated with mucinous and basal cell carcinomas, respectively.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The pigmented lesions suggest a diagnosis of melanocytic nevi. These patients are at increased risk of developing melanoma, which is characterized by S100-positive epithelioid cells with fine granules. Atypical keratinocytes forming keratin pearls are characteristic of squamous cell carcinoma, pale round cells with palisading nuclei are characteristic of basal cell carcinoma, and mucin-filled cells with peripheral nuclei are characteristic of adenocarcinoma.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's pigmented lesions are consistent with a diagnosis of melanocytic nevi, which puts her at an increased risk of developing melanoma. S100 is a marker for the diagnosis of melanoma, so the correct answer is B. Atypical keratinocytes forming keratin pearls are seen in squamous cell carcinoma, mucin-filled cells with peripheral nuclei are seen in adenocarcinoma, and pale, round cells with palisading nuclei are seen in basal cell carcinoma, none of which are associated with an increased risk of melanoma in a patient with melanocytic nevi.

S100-positive epithelioid cells with fine granules are characteristic of melanoma. Atypical keratinocytes forming keratin pearls and pale, round cells with palisading nuclei are characteristic of squamous cell carcinoma and basal cell carcinoma, respectively. Mucin-filled cells with peripheral nuclei are characteristic of mucinous carcinoma.
